Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
fxti - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: FXTI Process
Screen.Label: F-X trace interpolation for regularly sampled traces.
OPT_INPUT=
HDR_LINE=
DIP_MAX=
FREQ_BEG=
FREQ_END=
NUM_PTS=
NUM_TR=
WIN_LEN=
INTERP_INC=

Help.Tip: Whether input is a sequence of lines or regular trace gathers.
Help.Text:
fxti - OPT_INPUT
Whether input is a sequence of lines or regular trace gathers.
 
 Default = LINES
 Allowed = LINES
 Allowed = GATHER
 If OPT_INPUT = LINES, then the input is expected to be one or more lines
 (either all inlines or all crosslines).  HDR_LINE must be a constant value
 within each line and increment the same amount for each line change.
 Single trace input is required.
 
 If OPT_INPUT = GATHER, then the input is expected to be regular trace
 gathers.  Gathered trace input is required and the output will be gathered.
 This mode also allows fxti to run in parallel.

Help.Tip: Header word designating input lines.
Help.Text:
fxti - HDR_LINE
Header word designating input lines.
 
 Default = 8
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 HDR_LINE must be a constant value within each input line and increment the
 same amount for each input line change.  Not active if OPT_INPUT = GATHER.

Help.Tip: Maximum dip to retain, in ms/tr, before interpolation.
Help.Text:
fxti - DIP_MAX
Maximum dip to retain, in ms/tr, before interpolation.
 
 Default =
 Allowed = real >= 0.0
 This is a critical FXTI parameter.  Larger values increase run time.

Help.Tip: Low end of frequency range for the prediction filter, in Hz.
Help.Text:
fxti - FREQ_BEG
Low end of frequency range for the prediction filter, in Hz.
 
 Default =  10.0
 Allowed = Nyquist>real>=0.0
 FREQ_BEG and FREQ_END determine the bandwidth of the prediction filter only.
 FXTI will interpolate from zero frequency to Nyquist.

Help.Tip: High end of frequency range for the prediction filter, in Hz.
Help.Text:
fxti - FREQ_END
High end of frequency range for the prediction filter, in Hz.
 
 Default = 70.0
 Allowed = Nyquist>=real>FREQ_BEG
 FREQ_BEG and FREQ_END determine the bandwidth of the prediction filter only.
 FXTI will interpolate from zero frequency to Nyquist.

Help.Tip: Number of points for the prediction filter design.
Help.Text:
fxti - NUM_PTS
Number of points for the prediction filter design.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = int, 3 - 30  for INTERP_INC = 1
 Allowed = int, 4 - 30  for INTERP_INC = 2
 Normally NUM_PTS should be in the range of 3 - 11.
 For INTERP_INC =1, NUM_PTS should be 3, 5, 7 : start from 3 increment by 2
 For INTERP_INC =2, NUM_PTS should be 4, 7, 10: start from 4 increment by 3

Help.Tip: Number of traces for the prediction filter.
Help.Text:
fxti - NUM_TR
Number of traces for the prediction filter.
 
 Default = 22
 Allowed = int, 5 - 200
 NUM_TR should be >= 2*NUM_PTS and is normally 3 or 4 times NUM_PTS.

Help.Tip: Length, in seconds, of the local time window.
Help.Text:
fxti - WIN_LEN
Length, in seconds, of the local time window.
 
 Default = 0.6
 Allowed = real > 0.0
 It is not usually necessary to change the default.

Help.Tip: Number of trace inserted between two original traces.
Help.Text:
fxti - INTERP_INC
Number of trace inserted between two original traces.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int, 1 - 2
 INTERP_INC =1, the output spacing decreased by 2.
 INTERP_INC =2, the output spacing decreased by 3.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
fxti - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
fxti - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
fxti - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
fxti - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
fxti - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
fxti - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
fxti - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
fxti - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
fxti - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
fxti - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
fxti - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : FXTI  (F-X Trace Interpolation)
 Category   : miscellaneous
 Written    : 1998-02-19   by: Stephen Chiu
 Revised    : 2006-06-20   by: B. Menger
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : F-X trace interpolation for regularly sampled traces.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : Yes for GATHER input, no for LINES input.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 
 The trace interpolation is performed in frequency and space (F-X) domain
 within a small window which is overlapped 50 percent both in time and space.
 The algorithm is based on the paper (Seismic trace interpolation in the F-X
 domain, S. Spitz, Geophysics, 1991, p. 785-794).  Linear events in F-X domain
 can be modelled by a linear prediction filter. The prediction filter
 coefficients are used to obtain a set of normal equations for the unknown
 interpolated values. The advantage of this algorithm is that it is capable of
 interpolating beyond aliasing and of handling conflicting dips.  However,
 regular spacing is required.
 
 
 Trace Input/Output
 
 If OPT_INPUT = GATHER, then the input is expected to be regular trace
 gathers.  Gathered trace input is required.
 
 If OPT_INPUT = LINES, then the input is expected to be one or more lines
 (either all inlines or all crosslines).  HDR_LINE must be a constant value
 within each line and increment the same amount for each line change.
 Single trace input is required.
 
 FXTI outputs one trace at a time for OPT_INPUT = LINES,
 but outputs one gather at a time for OPT_INPUT = GATHER.
 
 FXTI also is parallelized for OPT_INPUT = GATHER, but use a single CPU for
 for OPT_INPUT = LINES.
 
 Historical Note
 
 FXTI is a conversion of the former CPS process RSTI.  The former CPS process
 FXTI used a flawed algorithm.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                            ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 
 Frequency Range of FXTI
 
 FXTI will interpolate from zero frequency to Nyquist.  The parameters
 FREQ_BEG and FREQ_END determine the bandwidth of the prediction filter only.
 
 
 Interpolated Traces
 
 FXTI will interpolate one or two traces between each two sequential
 input traces.  The sequence of output traces consists of one original input
 trace, followed by one or two interpolated traces, followed by one original,
 and so on.  If the number of original sequential input traces is m,
 the total numberof output traces is 2*m - 1 for INTERP_INC of 1;
 the total numberof output traces is 3*m - 2 for INTERP_INC of 2.
 
 
 Parameter Setting
 
 Normally the NUM_TR, NUM_PTS and WIN_LEN parameters need not be changed from
 their default values.  The FREQ_BEG and FREQ_END parameters usually are not
 critical.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author         Description
     ----        ------         -----------
 20. 2006-06-20  B. Menger      Removed Unused Variables.
 19. 2004-05-24  R Selzler      Corrected declarations that were technically
                                incorrect (failed compiler run time checks).
                                Corrected array conformance on assignment.
                                Corrected declaration of scalar (int not real)
 18. 2004-03-11  R Selzler      Correct one uninitialized scalar variable
                                and improve buffer management.
 17. 2003-08-14  Stephen Chiu   Add a new option to interpolate two traces
                                between two original traces
 16. 2003-07-30  Stephen Chiu   Change to a warning message instead of fatal
                                error when wiener solution fails
                                between two original traces.
 15. 2003-07-22  Stoeckley      Fix bugs in fxti_out which are manifested when
                                the trace and header array arguments have first
                                dimensions greater than ndpt or nwih.
 14. 2003-06-18  Chiu/Burch     Change output to a gather when input is a
                                gather. Parallelized in CMP gather mode.
 13. 2001-03-22  Stephen Chiu   Fix when autocorrelation is zero
 12. 2001-02-23  Stephen Chiu   Fix when number of input trace < NUM_TR in
                                LINES option.
 11. 2001-02-15  Stephen Chiu   Remove print statements.
 10. 2000-12-07  Stephen Chiu   Change wrapped_up to skip_wrapup.
 9.  2000-09-05  Stephen Chiu   Fix problems in gather mode.
 8.  2000-05-22  Stephen Chiu   Convert into new CPS.
 7.  1999-08-10  Stephen Chiu   Fix overflow problems in 3D stack.
 6.  1999-04-05  Stephen Chiu   Optimization of the code.
 5.  1998-11-05  Karen Goodger  Begin using f90 compiler.
 4.  1998-08-26  Stephen Chiu   Fix mute of input dead traces.
 3.  1998-08-13  Karen Goodger  Add call to CPSPRTS.
 2.  1998-03-10  stephen chiu   Fix the zero value in LINEHDR header.
 1.  1998-02-19  stephen chiu   original version
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
